column2: Finanziamenti da bandi europei e internazionali/esteri (pubblici o privati)
column10: BOELLA G. - Progetto UIA01-051 CO-CITY - The collaborative management of urban commons to counteract poverty and sociospatial polarisation - Scad. 30/10/2019
column16: CO­CITY is intended to break the self­reinforcing circle of poverty
column17: social segregation in deprived neighbourhoods and lack of participation. It achieves this by supporting the development of an innovative
column18: polycentric “commons­based urban welfare” composed of generative communities centred on urban commons
column19: low-cost service co­production
column21: and care of public spaces.CO­CITY is innovative in its legal
column23: providing:­ an unconventional legal framework to enable citizens to take care of urban commons;­ an innovative ICT infrastructure for local social market and networking; management tutoring towards economic sustainability.The authoritative approach is replaced by a collaborative one that considers citizens as potential changemakers
column24: agents of virtuous circular processes of commoners’ welfare. Meanwhile
column25: the public sector evolves from being a service provider to being an enabler and a partner. CO­CITY focuses on the cyclic process of “place production” rather than on a specific social target or deprived area. Empty public or private spaces become an opportunity instead of a cost and urban care becomes a collective task. This approach shares the logic of urban commons
column26: helping to tackle social exclusion and neighbourhood deprivation
column27: promoting commons’ use values rather than assets’ exchange values
column28: and enabling hidden resources of social capital to emerge.
column32: BOELLA

column10: PADOVANI L. - Progetto UE n. 778233 BEHAPI (H2020-MSCA-RISE-2017)
column16: APIs are typically flat structures
column17: i.e. sets of service/method signatures specifying the expected service parameters and the kind of results one should expect in return. However
column18: correct API usage also requires the individual services to be invoked in a specific order. Despite its importance
column19: the latter information is either often omitted
column20: or stated informally via textual descriptions. Behavioural Types are a suite of technologies that formalise of this information
column21: elevating flat API descriptions to a graph structure of services. This permits automated analyses for correct API compositions so as to provide guarantees such as service compliance
column23: dynamic adaptation in the presence of failure
column24: load balancing etc. The proposed project aims to bring the existing prototype tools based on these technologies to mainstream programming languages and development frameworks used in industry.

column17: decision support and training on private international law. It addresses the identification of the legal system having jurisdiction and of the national law to be applied to a case
column18: as well as the retrieval of relevant legal materials. The platform will deliver a A) free of charge information and decision support service directed to legal professionals (lawyers

column11: GENA C. - Bando PRIN 2017 - Programmi di Rilevante Interesse Nazionale - Linea A - EMPATHY: Empowering People in Dealing with Internet of Things Ecosystems
column16: EMPATHY
column17: The design and development of flexible software able to match the many possible users’ needs is still a difficult challenge. It is almost impossible to identify all the requirements at design time
column18: and such requirements would not be definitive because user needs are likely to evolve over time
column19: and designers should consider the wide variability of the possible contexts of use. Furthermore
column20: the explosion of mobile and Internet of Things (IoT) technologies has made it possible for people to access their applications from a variety of contexts of use that differ in terms of available devices
column21: things
column23: it is not possible to guarantee a complete fit between the initially designed system and actual user needs at any given time. As a result
column24: it is important to design software through methods and tools able to dynamically and quickly responding to new requirements
column25: and which are able to consider that the boundaries between design-time and run-time have become more and more blurred. Achieving this can increase the impact of software development companies since their applications can more easily penetrate many markets thanks to their ability to be customized directly by domain experts.End-User Development (EUD) approaches can help to face this challenge by enabling people without programming knowledge to tailor software applications. Their backgrounds can differ
column26: but such users share the need for software to flexibly support their tasks
column27: which may vary rapidly
column28: and some of them cannot even be anticipated at design time
column29: but discovered only during actual use. In addition
column30: current software development cycles and lack of domain knowledge by software developers are limitations to address requirements of different users. Thus
column31: EUD can reduce time and costs needed for customizations and increase software quality by avoiding potential misunderstandings between final users and developers. The advantage for users is that applications flexibly meet their needs. The advantage for professional software developers is that their applications can have broader adoption
column32: impact and diffusion.This aspect is now more crucial than ever with IoT becoming a mature and widespread technology. The fundamental challenge is to empower end users to configure smart environments able to exploit up to hundreds or thousands of interconnected devices and objects
column33: which will enable many possible interactions in a user’s surrounding. In this project
column35: well-known at international level
column36: are willing to join their expertise and efforts to identify solutions to this challenge. The goal is to allow users to control smart IoT applications rather than being driven by them.The EMPATHY research project aims at developing new concepts
column39: and tools to support people in creating and tailoring IoT context-dependent interactive applications for their needs. In this perspective
column40: the project will also address security and privacy concerns. It will also focus on how to support end user developers in easily identifying and fixing errors that they might have unintentionally introduced in their developed applications. The theoretical contribution of EMPATHY will guide the design of a platform able to support domain experts to tailor context-dependent IoT applications
column41: in order to adapt applications for their activities in a productive way. We will also demonstrate how it can be deployed in various real-world settings.The project will be developed along six Work Packages and provide these main results:-) a set of abstractions
column43: and methods to support both domain experts and end users in creating and tailoring IoT context-dependent interactive applications for their needs through a meta-design approach;-) a platform offering: 1) a tailoring environment for domain experts
column44: which provides novel interaction metaphors and multimodal interfaces to specif

column10: Advanced Smart Technologies for Fast and Reliable COVID-19 Detection
column15: DiACOVID punta allo sviluppo di una piattaforma innovativa che includa tecnologie e strumenti avanzati per il rilevamento rapido e affidabile dell'infezione COVID-19 e la raccolta dei dati. Il progetto affronterà 3 tracce applicative:Traccia 1: Analisi molecolare senza PCR di SARS-CoV-2. Svilupperà tecnologie rapide e sensibili per il rilevamento molecolare privo di PCR di SARS-CoV-2
column16: combinando metodi biochimici innovativi (visualizzazione dei fagi e ibridazione genomica cooperativa) e rilevamento dell'elettrochemiluminescenza. La traccia fornirà infine un proto funzionale avanzato in formato PoC (DiaCOVID Molecular Test). Anche se DiaCOVID dimostrerà questa tecnologia in formato PoC
column17: può essere vantaggiosamente integrata in macchine automatizzate ad alto rendimento.Traccia 2: Analisi radiologica avanzata con Algos di intelligenza artificiale (AI). Svilupperà metodi basati su moderne tecniche di intelligenza artificiale per analizzare immagini radiologiche (scansione TC o raggi X) per identificare e caratterizzare l'evidenza specifica di CoVID-19 della polmonite interstiziale. Questa traccia porterà a modelli predittivi per la progressione della malattia e strumenti di screening rapido da utilizzare sulle immagini a raggi X
column18: offrendo un proto ALGO software avanzato (DiaCOVID ALGO).Traccia 3: Repository di dati Edge-cloud Tenant AI sicuro. Svilupperà una piattaforma IT edge-cloud che implementa il concetto di tenant AI sicuro

column20: l'archiviazione e il reporting degli utenti finali ( ad es. medici o autorità sanitarie pubbliche) con un accesso in tempo reale e onnipresente ai risultati dell'analisi. column10: Aggregate Computing for resilient Urban Mobility Environments and Networks
column15: La società di oggi utilizza sempre più dispositivi personali come smartphone e dispositivi che compongono l'Internet of Things (IoT) in evoluzione. Proponiamo una soluzione innovativa
column16: resiliente e decentralizzata e di tutela della privacy per le attuali sfide nei trasporti e nella gestione dei dati nelle aree urbane attraverso una più stretta integrazione di dispositivi personali
column17: infrastrutture ICT pubbliche e private. Ci concentriamo su aree di applicazione ad alto potenziale per risolvere le sfide della mobilità urbana nella gestione delle informazioni di trasporto personalizzate e dell'accessibilità della folla sfruttando l'avvento dell'onnipresente elaborazione e networking peer-to-peer attraverso reti 5G.Il nostro approccio consente un modo indipendente dal venditore e dalla piattaforma di utilizzare i dati per rispondere efficacemente alle sfide della mobilità urbana come la disuguaglianza della mobilità
column18: la resilienza delle infrastrutture e incoraggiando la mobilità sostenibile attraverso i viaggi multimodali. In un processo co-creativo con le principali parti interessate del trasporto
column19: progettiamo insieme modelli di input per consentire la simulazione di scenari di accessibilità. La privacy per gli utenti finali è garantita attraverso la raccolta di dati a livello locale attraverso la nuova architettura del calcolo aggregato che garantisce efficienza e resilienza attraverso la comunicazione diretta tra i dispositivi in ​​una ristretta area geografica (ovvero la vicinanza personale). Il progetto fornisce modelli concettuali
column21: simulazioni e valutazioni per rafforzare il processo decisionale locale per l'accessibilità urbana intelligente.
column22: Today’s society increasingly makes use of personal devices like smart phones and devices that make up the evolving Internet of Things (IoT). We propose a novel
column23: resilient and decentralised
column24: and privacy-preserving solution to current challenges in transportation and data management in urban areas through a closer integration of personal devices
column25: public and private ICT infrastructures. We focus on high potential application areas for resolving urban mobility challenges to Personalized Transport information and Crowd accessibility Management by exploiting the advent of ubiquitous peer-to-peer computing and networking through 5G networks.Our approach enables a vendor- and platform-independent way to use data to respond effectively to  urban mobility challenges such as mobility inequality
column26: infrastructure resilience and encouraging sustainable mobility through multimodal travel. In a co-creative process with main transport stakeholders
column27: we co-design input models to enable simulation of accessibility scenarios. Privacy for end-users is ensured through data collection on a local level through the novel architecture of aggregate computing that ensures efficiency and resiliency through communication directly between devices in a narrow geographical area (i.e. personal proximity). The project provides conceptual models
column28: insights
column29: simulations and evaluations to bolster local decision making for smart urban accessibility.

column51: the linguistics units will be focused on the stereotypes and prejudices emerging from racial hoaxes in order to develop computational models for automatic detection of stereotypes and prejudices to be disseminated among IT companies and online platforms. Furthermore all the researchers involved will contribute to develop an ad hoc technological application which will be used by digital natives in the psychological experimental phase in educational settings where testing ‘best practices’ aimed at developing ‘antibodies’ overcoming prejudices reinforced by fake information. Other educational functions will be implemented with additional rewriting functions of prejudicial comments (by means of a so called civil alert) and cross-cultural maps that allow digital natives to better understand the effects of fake communication. In particular the project will design intervention activities involving teachers and students in order to communicate science by raising civic awareness. These activities will be the base for the science communication measures directed toward also future teachers by means of psycho-pedagogical guidelines but mainly through an e-learning course disseminated through the Uninettuno University platform that will involve all the partners that will contribute to disseminate their project activities. On the other part the project will disseminate their results involving also industrial companies and policy makers

column10: Anticipating and preventing coronavirus- and health-related hate speech online
column16: The ANTIVIR project will monitor and decode portrayals of ethnic others as causing or conveying disease and uncleanliness
column17: with the aim of preventing humanitarian values from falling victim to COVID-19 and future health crises. COVID-19 hasalready used by populist parties as a rationale to advocate anti-immigrant and Eurosceptic sentiment; such discourses willmultiply and flare during future public health crises. ANTIVIR will research xenophobic uses of health language
column18: enabling thecreation of a new monitoring tool and resources for stakeholders and the public. First
column19: media in which minorities aredenigrated as diseased or unclean will be analysed. Qualitative research with stakeholders and a quantitative survey of thepublic will then be conducted in five countries
column20: with a focus on vulnerabilities to “health xenophobia.” An ontology of termswill be created
column21: enabling the AI-driven analysis of social media. Pre-2020 corpora in English
column23: Dutch
column24: and Italian willbe re-analysed and current social media will be monitored
column25: allowing the comparative analysis of how health-related hatespeech proliferates over time. The consortium will develop a novel
column26: open-source ANTIVIR social media monitoring toolcapable of tracking health-related hate speech
column27: flagging it for reporting
column28: and referring users to good practices for counteringand preventing its harms. The consortium will also produce educational materials for secondary school teachers; policybriefs; a podcast; and digital assets. The project will yield the first mixed-methods study of health-related xenophobia inEurope and will develop a monitoring tool more sophisticated and more usable than current tools. At least 565 stakeholderswill take part in ANTIVIR workshops and at least 25 will take part in a final policy seminar. A robust supporter network andthe ALDA network of over 300 organisations will ensure wide public sector uptake of the tool and its accompanying policybriefs and countermeasures.

column15: What makes a team effective has been widely studied across disciplines and applicative contexts. Several factors such as communication
column16: coordination
column17: distinctive roles
column18: interdependent tasks
column19: shared norms
column21: and diversity have been found to be relevant aspects. Yet
column22: our understanding of teams as evolving systems of interacting individuals as well as of the relation between team composition and performance is still partial. The heterogeneity of interaction patterns in co-present
column23: virtual or distributed teams and the widespread adoption of multi-team and multilevel systems in which nested groups cooperate to perform functions at different scales
column24: add additional challenges to capture the complexity of modern organizations. In contrast
column25: the large majority of the relevant literature mainly dealt with self-reported surveys
column26: in-depth interviews
column27: or observations in scenarios with limited complexity
column28: scale
column31: the access to digital traces on human activities is providing unprecedented opportunities to mine the emergent behavior of large-scale
column32: loosely coupled
column33: teams and task-oriented multilevel groups. In this context
column34: machine learning pipelines were proposed to predict team performance that however was mainly i) focused on specific aspects while overlooking the holistic picture underpinning team dynamics ii) used a static snapshot to characterize composition and interactions and iii) adopted hand-designed features that often fail to capture the complexity of high-order functional relationships. To tackle these issues
column35: this project aims to provide a novel methodological framework – called Dteam2vect – to predict team performance leveraging representational learning on temporal graphs. Our approach is based on the hypothesis that graphs embeddings offer a natural way to infer high-order representations of interacting systems
column36: and state-of-the-art embedding methods can be extended to account for the temporal dynamics introduced by teams that continuously form
column38: and grow over time. Since representational learning comes with a well-known trade-off between accuracy and interpretability of the prediction outcome
column39: our approach aims at carefully exploring the dimensions of explainability and underlying biases
column40: to ensure that results are not a mere effect of the statistical tendencies of benchmarks.

column23: and how authorities and decisionmakers need holistic
column24: interactive
column25: and expressive means of analyzing mobility data. However

column28: urban planners

column30: MOMENTUM proposes to augment urban planning with data science: to build a conceptual map of modern mobility; to develop data-driven mobility models from digital traces using new and old concepts; to communicate the outcomes from these models using advanced multivariate visualization; to make the knowledge and insights from the application and visualization models fairer by mitigating data and algorithmic bias
column31: and to integrate all the previous steps into an actionable insights platform for impact assessment of city interventions and mobility scenarios. Moreover
column32: MOMENTUM's approach is transdisciplinary because it involves stakeholders during the whole project execution. In this way
column33: MOMENTUM broadens the knowledge and action capacity aimed at improving the quality of life through one of the most pervasive and relevant aspects of a society: its mobility.

column10: DI CARO L. - Analytics for DEcision of LEgal cases- ADELE-Call: JUST-AG-2020 / JUST-JACC-EJU-AG-2020 - G.A. n. 101007420
column15: Il progetto ADELE si basa sul cambiamento di paradigma in corso verso il calcolo cognitivo e l'intelligenza artificiale centrata sull'uomo che sta trasformando molte attività socio-economiche
column16: inclusa la giustizia. Il progetto applica l'analisi legale (LA)
column17: l'apprendimento automatico e tecniche di elaborazione del linguaggio naturale a supporto delle decisioni giudiziarie.
column18: Project ADELE is premised on the ongoing paradigm shift towards cognitive computing and human-centered AI which istransforming many socio-economic activities
column19: including justice. The project applies legal analytics (LA) – a blend of datascience
column20: machine learning and natural language processing techniques – to judicial decisions: it aims to (1) develop methodsto extract knowledge and engage in outcome predictions
column21: and therefrom (2) build a pilot tool to support legal research anddecision-making processes in the judiciary. The project will begin with the analysis of four datasets of judgments respectivelyof Italian and Bulgarian case law in the fields of Intellectual Property
column22: and Unfair Commercial Practices (WP2). Annotationguidelines will be developed and used to tag the datasets. Domain-specific ontologies and citation networks will be built. InWP3 tagged documents will be processed with machine learning algorithms to extract legal arguments and predict possibleoutcome of new cases. Two German datasets will be collected and used as a language transferability test. WP4 will developa pilot tool embedding knowledge extraction and outcome prediction functionalities. The tool will be subject to (1) apreliminary test on a beta-version of the tool; (2) a validation test on the final pilot (WP5). Tests will take place both inBulgaria and Italy with specialized end-users. The main outputs of ADELE will be (1) a LA methodological framework and (2)a pilot tool to support activities of justices in the Italian and Bulgarian courts. These novel solutions will have a strong impacton the efficacy and transparency of judicial decision-making by developing automated means that enhance theunderstanding of the law
column23: facilitate judicial tasks and reduce the courts’ workload. It will contribute to developing atrustworthy AI by producing ethical and robust LA methods for the judiciary and will foster scientific debate on the use of AItechnologies in the legal field.

Teaching AI remains confined to specialist courses at the undergraduate and graduate levels in our technical universities. Few attempts have been made so far to bring AI to secondary and primary schools
column56: and such efforts have primarily focused on using AI as a powerful tool
column57: instead of fully grasping AI concepts. To close this gap
column58: the overarching goal of the SMaILE project is to make AI concepts accessible to a wide spectrum of young adults and children and empower them to understand AI in-depth as well as to create AI technology. Starting early in AI education is believed to have numerous beneficial effects
column59: such as sparking interest in this discipline in a broader and more diverse audience
column60: fostering the adoption of advanced AI tools that can assist in several tasks
column61: and supporting responsible use of this technology based on a clear discernment of the limitations and risks associated to it. The SMaILE project aims at promoting knowledge and awareness of the principles
column63: and applications of AI in order to support its conscious and effective use. To achieve this objective
column64: SMaILE builds a novel approach to teaching AI based on the insight of Game Theory and Mechanism Design and uses tools from Gamification to underpin a teaching methodology that maximizes the engagement and motivation of the students allowing them to achieve ambitious learning outcomes. SMaILE is composed of two sub-projects that operate in a synergic and complementary way. The first one focuses on defining an efficient teaching methodology through an educational platform that helps the students to develop their AI competencies together with a range of physical gaming and entertaining activities that will be conducted together with the local partner institutions and associations. The second sub-project is concerned with the design and development of a new application - SMaILEApp – that will be used both to teach AI via an active modality by playing suitable designed games

column22: che caratterizza molti metodi di machine learning correnti (dedinduction); (2) introduce la creatività nell'apprendimento. column33: Learning and Creativity are two driving forces for the evolution of humankind. Learning brings newborns to knowing interpretative models of a given human society
column34: whereas creativity is the ability to break learnt interpretative models to envision new ideas
column35: which can revolutionise a given society or even the whole humankind. Intelligent machines are still far from exploiting the virtuous interplay between learning and creativity
column36: however we want to build a new computational model implemented in a proper software architecture that goes beyond machines limitations.Kreye proposes Creative Dedinductive Machine Learning (CDML) as a novel class of intelligent machines that may infer and exploit creative patterns from data in a virtuous cycle which puts the human in the loop. CDML is a new paradigm that: (1) incorporates deductive learning in the consolidated inductive learning paradigm that characterises many current machine learning methods (dedinduction); (2) incorporates creativity in learning. CDML is crucial to bring machine learning to the next level. In fact
column37: dedinductive learning can solve cases where inductive learning has not chances and deductive learning is necessary.Kreye will explore the mechanisms of human creativity and learning and the concept of trend behind the work of designers and scientists

column10: Intelligenza artificiale per la diagnosi di COVID19 da immagini radiografiche
column15: Il COVID-19 si è rapidamente diffuso nella Cina continentale ed in diversi paesi sparsi in tutto il mondo. Al 29 maggio 2020 in Italia
column16: uno dei paesi più gravemente colpiti
column17: sono stati registrati 232248 pazienti affetti da COVID-19 di cui 33219 deceduti; al momento il Piemonte è la seconda regione maggiormente colpita in Italia
column18: con 30501 casi registrati (http://www.salute.gov.it).La diagnosi precoce è un elemento chiave per il corretto trattamento dei pazienti e la prevenzione della diffusione della malattia.Nell’ambito di questo progetto miriamo a tre obiettivi:costruire un dataset decentralizzato di CXR e CT con COVID ground-truth e radiological findings; sviluppare uno strumento AI che sia open e validato per la diagnosi del COVID
column19: da condividere con la comunità scientifica e clinica;analizzare l’efficacia di un utilizzo integrato di CXR e CT per la lotta alla pandemia causata da COVID: il primo strumento dovrebbe svolgere un ruolo significativo per la diagnosi precoce e la definizione delle priorità dei pazienti in fase di emergenza
column20: il secondo dovrebbe contribuire a prevedere la prognosi e il trattamento.(sottoposto alla fase 1 del bando FONDO INTEGRATIVO SPECIALE PER LA RICERCA (FISR))

column22: one of the most severely affected countries
column23: 232248 Patients with COVID19 were recorded
column24: and 33219 of them died; at the time of writing Piedmont is the 2nd most affected region in Italy
column25: with 30501 recorded cases (http://www.salute.gov.it). Early diagnosis is a key element for proper treatment of the patients and prevention of the spread of the disease.In this project we target three major objectives:build a multicenter dataset of CXR and CT scan with annotated COVID groudtruth and radiological findings;develop an open and validated AI tool for COVID diagnosis from CXR to be shared with clinical and scientific community;analyse the effectiveness of integrated CXR and CT scan usage in fighting COVID pandemic: the first tool is expected to play a significant role for early diagnosis and patient prioritization in emergency stage

column17: il tracciamento automatico o digitale dei contatti (DCT) sembra uno dei più promettenti [1] e largamente accettato dall'opinione pubblica [2].Il DCT è quindi una componente fondamentale della strategia a tripla T

column20: il potenziale nuovo caso inizia l'isolamento e richiede il test a domicilio. Tale test dovrebbe essere raccolto e valutato al più presto
column21: al fine di allertare tutte le persone in contatto con lei/lui. Tuttavia se il test è in ritardo

column24: sebbene il DCT abbia comunque effetto anche con percentuali inferiori.Di conseguenza

column38: automatic or digital contact tracing (DCT) seems one of the most promising [1] and widely accepted by public opinion [2].The DCT measure is therefore a fundamental component of the triple T strategy
column41: it consists in a smartphone app for automatically tracing the contacts of people in order to trace them faster as soon as a new case occurs. After reporting the main symptoms (e.g.
column43: the potential new case starts isolation and requests home test. Such a test should be collected and evaluated as soon as possible in order to alert all the people in contact with her/him. But it the test is delayed
column44: the benefits of the DCT can be wasted. In accordance to the research findings reported in [1] and supplementary materials [3]
column45: their models show that it is possible to stop the epidemic if the adoption rate of the DCT app is approximately 60% of the population
column46: even if the DCT has an effect at all levels of uptake. Accordingly
column47: the DCT poses a challenge to the logistic of the local health system in terms of number to daily test to be collected and evaluated
column48: especially when the spreading of the virus is increasing. Besides
column49: a prioritization method is required especially when the number of test is larger than the system capability in order to identify which are those that are necessarily to be tested.The aim of this research proposal is to develop a prototype decision support system (DSS) in order to optimize the test and trace logistics to contain the Covid19 pandemic. Our DSS takes into account the number of tests to be collected on the next day assigning them a prioritization score. Then

column10: PATTI V. - Contributo Google - Progetto Be Positive! (capofila ACMOS)
column15: Be Positive! e' un progetto finanziato da Google nell'ambito del bandoGoogle.org Impact Challenge on Safety: https://impactchallenge.withgoogle.com/safety2019/charities/acmos-cifa. È uno dei 29 progetti selezionati tra le 900 proposte ricevute e valutate su questo bandoBe Positive! si configura come follow-up del progetto Contro l'odio. Ha lo scopo di raccogliere e identificare automaticamente l'hate speech online al fine di aumentare i contenuti positivi in rete rivolti a gruppi vulnerabili alle discriminazioni e promuovere la loro presenza attiva sui social media. Be Positive! ha tra i suoi obiettivi:- il miglioramento delle mappe dell'odio sviluppate nell'ambito del progetto Contro l’odio;- la creazione di un assistente automatico alla scrittura di contenuti positivi contro l'odio- l'organizzazione di corsi di formazione rivolti a scuole

column15: Il progetto SPICE ha come obiettivo la promozione della partecipazione nell'ambito dei beni culturali tramite un processo di citizen curation. I cittadini saranno supportati nello sviluppo delle loro personali interpretazioni degli oggetti culturali

column39: The overall aim of the project is to foster diverse participation in the heritage domain through a process of citizen curation. Citizens will be supported to: develop their own personal interpretations of cultural objects; work together to present their collective view of life through culture and heritage; and gain an appreciation of alternative cultural viewpoints.Methods will be codesigned that can be used by citizen groups to produce personal interpretations of cultural objects and analyse and compare them against the interpretations of others. Tools will be developed for modelling users and groups and recommending content in a way that assists citizen groups in building a representation of themselves and appreciating variety within groups and similarity across groups to enhance social cohesion. A Linked Data infrastructure will support citizen curation using social media platforms in a way that gives heritage institutions control over rights protected digital assets and access to citizens responses to their collections. User experiences will be designed that enable inclusive participation in citizen curation activities across cultures and abilities. A series of citizen curation case studies with a diverse set of museums and citizen groups will demonstrate how the approach can promote inclusive participation and social cohesion in a variety of contexts.The project brings together 13 partners from 7 countries. The consortium comprises: three SMEs ue

column24: tempo-dipendente; iv) analizzare il ruolo dell'ambiente; v) suggerire interventi che possano ritardare la progressione della malattia.BRAINTEASER integrerà grandi dataset clinici con nuovi dati personale e ambientali raccolti usando sensori e app a basso costo. column25: tendo conto dei bisogni tecnici

Saranno usato requisiti procedurali che permettano di sostenere la certificazione del Software come Dispositivo Medico
column27: coinvolgendo medici e pazienti e producendo una serie di raccomandazioni per le autorità sanitarie pubbliche. I risultati saranno diffusi secondo un paradigma di scienza aperta conferme all’iniziative European Open Science Cloud. inserire
column28: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) and Multiple Sclerosis (MS) are chronic diseases characterized by progressive or alternate impairment of neurological functions (motor
column31: cognitive). Patients have to manage alternated periods in hospital with care at home
column32: experiencing a constant uncertainty regarding the timing of the disease acute phases and facing a considerable psychological and economic burden that also involves their caregivers. Clinicians
column34: need tools able to support them in all the phases of the patient treatment
column35: suggest personalized therapeutic decisions
column36: indicate urgently needed interventions.Artificial Intelligence is the key to successfully satisfy these needs to: i) better describe disease mechanisms; ii) stratify patients according to their phenotype assessed all over the disease evolution; iii) predict disease progression in a probabilistic
column37: time dependent fashion; iv) investigate the role of the environment; v) suggest interventions that can delay the progression of the disease.BRAINTEASER will integrate large clinical datasets with novel personal and environmental data collected using low-cost sensors and apps. Software and mobile apps will be designed embracing an agile and user-centred design approach
column40: psychological and societal needs of the specific users.BRAINTEASER will implement a system able to guarantee cybersecurity and data ownership to the patients; will provide quantitative evidence of benefits and effectiveness of using AI in health-care pathways implementing a proof-of-concept of its use in real clinical setting. Procedural requirements that support Software as Medical Device certification will be used involving clinicians and patients stakeholders and producing a set of recommendations for public health authorities. Results will be disseminated accordingly to an open science paradigm under the European Open Science Cloud initiative.

The inception of the modern developments of Mathematical Logic essentially date with the failure of Hilbert’s program. column49: as they are understood today. column50: and both can improve the computations derivable from the proven theorem.The technical tools involving proofs

column11: A deep-learning-based digital twin model for prevention and detection of security threats in public environments
column16: DEEP-TWIN aims at designing and developing a highly innovative cognitive system that will exploit an AI-empowered digital twin to model large and complex environments for the early detection
column17: prediction and prevention of anomalous patterns and potentially dangerous behaviors. The concept of digital twins has emerged in recent years
column18: mainly in the area of predictive maintenance of industrial equipment but is rapidly gaining consensus also in other areas related to human behavioral analysis. In this project we have the ambitious objective to significantly advance this technology
column19: making it capable of modeling a complex indoor or outdoor environment
column20: populated by individuals and/or crowds. The potential applications of tools adopting this technology are countless: simulating complex situations in order to evaluate in advance possible hazards
column21: offering support to decision makers by previewing the most likely outcomes of different action patterns
column22: producing new-generation fully autonomous monitoring systems for urban spaces
column23: analyze threats in the planning of large events
column24: and many others.From a methodological viewpoint
column25: the development of DEEP-TWIN will require significant scientific advances in different areas. It will be necessary to build a virtual model of the monitored scene
column26: where each real entity will be associated to its corresponding “digital twin”. Proper computer vision and energy-efficient deep learning techniques will be developed in order to detect the relevant entities to be modelled
column27: such as individual persons
column28: groups and large crowds. High-level behavior interpretation modules will give a semantic meaning to complex events generated by these entities
column29: in order to identify potentially dangerous behaviors. When the explicit event recognition will not be feasible
column30: anomaly detection techniques will anyway allow to detect abnormal patterns of activity that could be related to relevant events. This high-level interpretation of the scene on one side will allow to act on the environment with proper countermeasures
column31: thanks to the development of self-awareness strategies to guide agents in the real world
column32: and on the other side will feed the digital twin module
column33: which is thus updated with real-world data. The ultimate goal is to produce a virtual world that mimics as much as possible the real one
column34: but that can also generalize to some extent. The virtual world will then be used to generate new data for model training
column35: to perform predictions by means of simulations
column36: and to offer the agents a “first-person”
column38: global view of the monitored scene and its state.

column15: Obiettivo del progetto è di riuscire a ripristinare un canale di comunicazione in pazienti che abbiano compromesso le loro possibilità comunicative a causa di malattie o incidenti
column16: come nel caso della Sclerosi laterale amiotrofica (SLA): una malattia neurodegenerativa che causa una rapida e progressiva disabilità motoria
column17: fino alla perdita completa della motilità. Quando la paralisi raggiunge infine anche i muscoli extraoculari il paziente rimane completamente isolato e incapace di comunicare (locked-in) anche se ancora in grado di percepire stimoli dall’esterno.Il progetto intende sviluppare un’innovativa forma di interazione uomo-macchina basata su due possibili canali di comunicazione: le onde cerebrali volontariamente prodotte dal paziente (segnali elettroencefalografici
column18: EEG) e il movimento pupillare
column19: anch’esso controllabile volontariamente (attraverso la risposta accomodativa) e apparentemente preservato nella SLA. La doppia funzionalità intende sopperire alla eventualità frequente di pazienti con funzionalità pupillare compromessa o con difficoltà ad imparare ed eseguire i task richiesti dalle Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) basate solo su segnali EEG
column20: The aim of the project is to be able to restore a communication channel in patients who have compromised their communication possibilities due to diseases or accidents
column21: as in the case of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS): a neurodegenerative disease that causes a rapid and progressive motor disability
column22: until the complete loss of motility. When the paralysis finally reaches the extraocular muscles as well
column23: the patient remains completely isolated and unable to communicate (locked-in) even though he is still able to perceive stimuli from the outside.The project intends to develop an innovative form of human-machine interaction based on two possible communication channels: brain waves voluntarily produced by the patient (electroencephalographic signals
column24: EEG) and pupillary movement
column25: also voluntarily controllable (through the accommodative response) and apparently preserved in ALS. The dual functionality aims to compensate for the frequent eventuality of patients with impaired pupillary function or with difficulty in learning and performing the tasks required by the Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) based only on EEG signals

column11: Languages and Analysis Techniques for Smart Contracts
column16: In recent years
column17: blockchain technologies have moved beyond the hype also thanks to the adoption of smart contracts. These contracts are computer programs immutably stored in a blockchain platform that define a set of rules to transfer crypto-assets between two or more participants. Everyday
column18: assets worth USD millions are automatically exchanged by smart contracts
column19: and the application scenarios of smart contracts have expanded
column21: pharmaceutical logistics
column22: tracking of luxury and fashion items
column23: public administration
column24: just to mention a few examples. Hence
column25: any vulnerability in a smart contract can have a dramatic impact on the resources that it manages. The permissionless nature of mainstream blockchains is particularly appealing for malicious users
column26: as shown by several attacks that smart contracts have suffered during the last years
column27: that led to the stealing or freezing of dozens of USD millions.The goal of this project is to apply formal methods to support the development of more reliable and secure smart contracts.First of all
column28: the project investigates the language foundations of smart contracts
column29: providing formal models of their key mechanisms and thus paving the way to their automatic verification. These models will be exploited in the design of domain-specific languages for smart contracts
column30: concisely capturing high-level behaviours of given application domains. Compared to using full-fledged languages like Solidity (the main language used in Ethereum)
column31: this has the benefit of minimizing the risk of programming errors. In particular
column32: we will consider the application domains of finance
column35: and public administration.In the second step of the project we will develop various forms of static analyses that verify critical qualitative and quantitative properties of smart contracts. Such analyses are aimed at (i) preventing asset abuses like asset loss and freezing
column36: (ii) ensuring the absence of unexpected access or modification of private state
column37: and (iii) estimating bounds on the overall flow of assets. These properties will be enforced through various forms of off-chain and on-chain analyses. Overall
column38: the main challenge for the study and development of such analyses is represented by the fact that smart contracts’ participants cannot be assumed to be honest
column39: unlike in traditional contexts where verification techniques are applied.The third and last contribution of the project will be the validation of the languages and analysis techniques on real-world scenarios
column41: financial and public administration contexts. Further
column42: we will investigate the compliance of smart contracts with legal constraints.

column10: Third Party CINI - ADMIRE - Adaptive multi-tier intelligent data manager for Exascale - Call H2020-JTI-EuroHPC-2019-1 - Grant Agreement n. 956748 - CUP F69J21003450007
column15: The growing need to process extremely large data sets is one of the main drivers for building exascale HPC systems today. However
column16: the flat storage hierarchies found in classic HPC architectures no longer satisfy the performance requirements of data-processing applications. Uncoordinated file access in combination with limited bandwidth make the centralised back-end parallel file system a serious bottleneck. At the same time
column17: emerging multi-tier storage hierarchies come with the potential to remove this barrier. But maximising performance still requires careful control to avoid congestion and balance computational with storage performance. Unfortunately
column18: appropriate interfaces and policies for managing such an enhanced I/O stack are still lacking.The main objective of the ADMIRE project is to establish this control by creating an active I/O stack that dynamically adjusts computation and storage requirements through intelligent global coordination
column19: malleability of computation and I/O
column20: and the scheduling of storage resources along all levels of the storage hierarchy. To achieve this
column21: we will develop a software-defined framework based on the principles of scalable monitoring and control
column23: and the orchestration of key system components and applications through embedded control points.Our software-only solution will allow the throughput of HPC systems and the performance of individual applications to be substantially increased – and consequently energy consumption to be decreased – by taking advantage of fast and power-efficient node-local storage tiers using novel
column24: European ad-hoc storage systems and in-transit/in-situ processing facilities. Furthermore
column25: our enhanced I/O stack will offer quality-of-service (QoS) and resilience. An integrated and operational prototype will be validated with several use cases from various domains
column26: including climate/weather
column27: life sciences
column28: physics

column19: UNITO è l’unica università selezionata per ricevere una RB- Rhea. La RB-Rhea sarà implementata con l’innovativa tecnica dei “chiplet” che permette di affiancare sullo stesso substrato di silicio diverse CPU specializzate. Le CPU si distinguono in due macro- categorie: 1) general-purpose CPU (ARMv8 ISA)
column20: 2) accelerator CPU-accelerator (RISC-V ISA). Il tipo e il numero di CPU-accelerator caratterizzano il multiprocessore per task di Intelligenza Artificiale (DNN) o Calcolo Scientifico (vector+stencil).

column24: The NoVAGraphS (Non-Visual Access to Graphical Structures) project wants to study the problem of accessing to scientific information contained in graphical structures by people with visual disabilities. Current technologies have made available various tools to help blind or partially sighted people. However
column25: these technologies often have severe limitations in some contexts that are not strictly textual. Indeed
column26: scientific books very often contain structured graphic information

column33: to allow the understanding of such structured graphics. The starting point of the project is the idea of making these structures navigable by a person with a visual disability.

column16: Integrazione a livello di sistema e caratterizzazione funzionale di RNA circolari nelle lesioni colorettali precancerose/canceroseIl cancro del colon-retto (CRC) si sviluppa progressivamente da cellule epiteliali del colon che si trasformano per formare polipi che possono evolvere in adenomi e infine diventare invasivi. Le alterazioni genetiche nelle cellule tumorali sono state caratterizzate come driver della progressione del CRC [PMID: 27189416]
column17: ma stanno emergendo nuove disregolazioni molecolari
column18: tra cui alterazioni epigenetiche ed espressione aberrante di RNA non codificanti [PMID: 31900466].Lo sviluppo del CRC può richiedere anni
column19: il che rende la sua diagnosi precoce fondamentale per ridurne la mortalità. Le procedure standard per lo screening primario sono i test delle feci
column20: la tomografia computerizzata e i metodi endoscopici. Sebbene questi metodi siano efficaci
column21: sono associati a bassa specificità e sensibilità per il primo e secondo metodo
column23: costi elevati e sensibilità operatore-dipendente per il terzo [PMID: 28811705]. L'identificazione di nuovi determinanti molecolari dell'insorgenza di CRC non solo fornirà approfondimenti sulla progressione della malattia
column24: ma potrà identificare biomarcatori per migliorare la diagnosi precoce non invasiva del CRC. L'aberrazione nello splicing alternativo dell'RNA sta emergendo come un segno distintivo delle cellule cancerose [PMID: 32303702]. In questo contesto
column25: gli RNA circolari (circRNA) sono RNA a filamento singolo che formano una struttura circolare continua come conseguenza di un evento di splicing alternativo chiamato back-slicing [PMID: 31343080]. I circRNA regolano l'espressione genica interagendo con i microRNA (miRNA) e le proteine ​​leganti l'RNA e la loro espressione alterata è stata osservata in diversi tumori
column26: tra cui CRC [PMID: 30735636] in cui sono correlati alla recidiva della malattia [PMID: 31475771] e all'adattamento metabolico del tumore [PMID: 31155494]. L'attività del circRNA è strettamente influenzata dalla loro localizzazione rispetto agli RNA/proteine ​​bersaglio all'interno del microambiente tumorale [PMID: 32917870] e stanno emergendo prove sugli assi regolatori circRNA-miRNA nelle interazioni ospite-microbioma a livello intestinale [PMID: 33419590]. Tuttavia
column27: i circRNA stanno suscitando un crescente interesse come biomarcatori diagnostici poiché la loro struttura li rende resistenti alle esonucleasi e più stabili degli RNA lineari nei biofluidi extracellulari [PMID: 33378673]. Tuttavia
column28: nonostante queste evidenze promettenti
column29: manca un'analisi sistematica dei circRNA nel CRC
column30: negli adenomi colorettali e nel tessuto surrogato del CRC (es. campione di feci)
column31: in particolare in considerazione di altre caratteristiche della malattia specifica del paziente
column32: comprese le alterazioni genetiche del tumore e il suo profilo trascrittomico
column34: lo stile di vita e le abitudini alimentari del paziente.Scopo del progetto e design.Questo progetto mira a identificare gli RNA circolari coinvolti nell'insorgenza di CRC da lesioni precancerose ed a caratterizzare la loro funzione sulla base dell'integrazione a livello di sistema dei dati degli stessi pazienti. column39: designed not only to provide biomedical insights but also to developdedicated computational tools that will be shared with the scientific community and applicable inother cancer studies.Colorectal cancer (CRC) progressively develops along a pathway in which colon epithelial cells transform to form polyps that can progress to adenomas and eventually become invasive. Genetic alterations in the tumor cells were characterized as drivers of CRC progression [PMID: 27189416]
column40: but novel molecular dysregulations are emerging including
column41: epigenetic alterations and aberrant noncoding RNAs expression [PMID: 31900466].CRC development may require years
column42: making its early detection pivotal in reducing mortality. The standard procedures for primary screening are stool-based tests
column44: and endoscopic methods. Although these methods are effective
column45: they are associated with low specificity and sensitivity for the first and second ones
column48: and operator- dependent sensitivity for the third [PMID: 28811705]. Identification of novel molecular determinants of CRC onset not only will provide insights on the disease progression
column49: but can identify biomarkers to improve the non-invasive early detection of CRC. Aberration in RNA alternative splicing is emerging as a hallmark of cancer cells [PMID: 32303702]. In this context
column50: circular RNAs (circRNAs) are single-stranded RNAs ​that form a closed continuous loop as a consequence of an alternative splicing event called back-splicing [PMID: 31343080]. CircRNAs regulate gene expression by interacting with microRNAs (miRNAs) and RNA binding proteins and their altered expression has been observed in several cancers
column51: including CRC [PMID: 30735636] in which were related to disease recurrence [PMID: 31475771] and tumor metabolic adaptation [PMID: 31155494]. The circRNA activity is strictly influenced by their localization with respect to target RNAs/proteins within the tumor microenvironment [PMID: 32917870] and evidence is emerging on circRNA-miRNA regulatory axes in host-microbiome interactions in the gut [PMID: 33419590]. Nonetheless
column52: circRNAs are raising growing interest as diagnostic biomarkers since their structure makes them resistant to exonucleases and more stable than linear RNAs in extracellular biofluids [PMID: 33378673]. However
column54: a systematic analysis of circRNAs in CRC

column61: and the patient lifestyle and dietary habits.Project aim and design.T​his project aims at identifying circularRNAs involved in the CRC onset from precancerous lesions and characterizing their function based on system-level integration of data from the same patients. Furthermore
column62: the project aims to provide evidence on the role of these molecules as biomarkers for the early non-invasive diagnosis of CRC.The project will be structured in sequential work packages (WP) developed by an interdisciplinary team

column15: Linguaggio tossico o abusivo sono termini generali che si riferiscono a svariati fenomeni e comportamenti osservati nella comunicazione verbale. La crescente disponibilità di contenuti generati da utenti online e la crescita delle piattaforme di social media presentano sfide eccezionali nei confronti del monitoraggio e prevenzione di comportamenti aggressivi ed abusivi in rete. column24: i particolare sui social media online. La metodologia è centrata sulla considerazione di diverse prospettive e sul fornire risultati dell'analisi del linguaggio tossico interpretabili e ricchi di sfaccettature.
column25: Toxic or abusive language are umbrella terms for many interconnected phenomena and behaviours mainlyencoded and predicated on natural language. The increasing availability of online user-generated content and growth of social media platforms presents special challenges when it comes to monitoring and limiting the presence of aggressive behaviours and abusive language online. While a large amount of language resources and machine learning models has been developed

column31: with the goal of building robust automatic classification models for several toxic phenomena in natural language

column11: Multilayer monitoring of response and tissue damage and reconstitution using blood-derived samples in follicular and mantle cell lymphoma
column17: The success of MCL and FL treatment is based on two critical achievements: persistent response and prevention of damage associated with anti-lymphoma treatment either in terms of recovery from early toxicity or prevention of long-term complications. Modern treatments allow obtaining overall response rates largely exceeding 80% in most therapeutic settings. Unfortunately
column18: relapse and long-term toxicities still represent unmet clinical needs resulting in morbidity and mortality in a vast proportion of patients. Despite a large bulk of basic and clinical research
column19: our knowledge on lymphoma kinetics after treatment (minimal residual disease
column20: MRD) as well as mechanisms underlying recovery from treatment-related injury and development of late toxicities (particularly secondary cancers) are still poorly characterized. Several studies have analyzed MRD with good results in predicting disease relapse. Nonetheless several limitations still exist
column21: including the need of targeting poorly accessible tissues such as bone marrow
column22: and lack of a broad picture of disease evolution due to the lack of information from nodal compartments which might be critical survival niches. On the other hand
column23: monitoring of post-treatment recovery and early identification of late toxicities are even less developed and efforts aimed at monitoring these phenomena are still in their infancy.The aim of this project is that of developing a multi-layer approach to MRD monitoring and early identification of damage of normal compartments
column24: by exclusive exploitation of peripheral blood (PB) derived tissues (i.e. PB-derived cells PB-derived cell-free DNA) as sources for analysis. The project will cover method development and analysis on preliminary clinically meaningful series and will target the following issues:1) MRD assessment on PB cells and cell-free DNA both for punctual analysis and through the development of kinetic models basedMUR - BANDO 2022Ministero dell'Università e della Ricercaon advanced computational tools;2) Analysis of the presence and evolution of acquired clonal genetic defects of the myeloid and lymphoid compartment
column25: both having a potentially relevant impact in the development of secondary tumors and other late toxicities;3) Analysis of the presence and evolution of dysbiosis of patient microbiota
column26: as detectable through the analysis of cf-DNA metagenomes as it arises as a consequence of cancer and delivery of anti-neoplastic treatment. This will represent a preliminary model to study starting from PB the recovery of a complex and diversified compartment that sustains severe damage during cancer treatment.In conclusion
column27: our project represents an effort to develop an integrated approach to the monitoring of patients for their risk of toxicity and relapse. Clearly
column28: the approach is still far from being comprehensive but should be regarded as an initial effort in the direction of a multi-level approach to the long-term monitoring of cancer patients by exclusive use of easily accessible tissues.

column30: a very important area of investigation for AI methodologies in cybersecurity: an adversary observes anomaly alerts and normal traffic
column31: and tries to replicate the learning process so as to produce a similar anomaly classifier

column15: Il progettoLe reti mobili si stanno evolvendo verso sistemi distribuiti che coniugano calcolo e connettivita in cui gli utenti finali ricevono servizi ed archiviano i dati per mezzo di elementi di elaborazione situati in diverse posizioni della rete. Tali elementi di calcolo sono gli elementi costitutivi per l'implementazione di Fog
column16: Edge e Cloud Computing [1]. La disponibilita di risorse computazionali accessibili con basse latenze da arte degli utenti delle reti mobili
column17: consente loro di migrare su queste piattaforme attività ad alta intensità di elaborazione. L'integrazione di risorse computazionali all'interno dell'infrastruttura di rete mobile da origine ad un ambiente per lo sviluppo di applicazioni nuove ed innovative.Possiamo descrivere l'elaborazione in rete come comprendente l'elaborazione alla periferia o all'interno della rete. Ci riferiamo al primo con il termine Multi-Access Edge Computing (MEC) e al secondo con il termine Cloud Computing [2]. Le due differenze chiave tra MEC e Cloud risiedono nella potenza di elaborazione e nella latenza. La potenza di calcolo e la capacità di archiviazione delle infrastrutture cloud in genere sono molto maggiori rispetto alle implementazioni edge. Tuttavia
column18: il ritardo nell'accesso alle risorse di elaborazione del cloud è generalmente molto più lungo rispetto all'accesso a quelle perimetrali. Le applicazioni che sono allo stesso tempo critiche per la latenza e parsimoniose per il calcolo vengono in genere distribuite su strutture perimetrali. Per motivi analoghi
column19: è consigliabile selezionare un server cloud ogni volta che un'applicazione utente è ad alta intensità di elaborazione e non è sensibile ai ritardi.La disponibilità di risorse di calcolo diverse e geograficamente distribuite solleva la questione di quale elemento di calcolo sia il più adatto a soddisfare i requisiti applicativi specifici e diventa ancora più rilevante per le applicazioni che non rientrano nelle due categorie estreme di cui sopra. Si consideri uno scenario in cui gli utenti finali sfruttano una fetta di una rete mobile
column20: inviando richieste di servizio in modo intermittente alle strutture informatiche di rete e necessitando di una risposta entro una scadenza. Questo tipo di domanda richiede di decidere per ogni richiesta dove è meglio indirizzarla per rispettare la scadenza specificata. Sia nel caso in cui un'entità centralizzata vicina alle risorse perimetrali effettui questa scelta sia nel caso in cui ogni utente sceglie indipendentemente definiscono degli scenari applicativi che sollevano nuove domande di ricerca.In questo progetto

column36: The ProjectMobile networks are evolving towards complex distributed connect-compute systems where end users receive services through data storage and processing elements located in different locations in the network. Such computing elements are the building blocks for implementing Fog
column38: and Cloud Computing [1]. Making available to mobile network users computing resources accessible with low latencies enables them to offload computing-intensive tasks. It opens up a new environment for developing novel and innovative applications
column41: and storage.We can describe in-network computing as comprising processing at the network periphery or in the network core. We refer to the former with the term Multi-Access Edge Computing (MEC) and the latter with the term Cloud Computing [2]. The two key differences between MEC and Cloud lay in processing power and latency. Cloud infrastructures' computing power and storage capacity usually are much larger than in edge deployments. However
column42: the delay incurred to access the cloud's computing resources is usually much longer than to access those at the edge. Applications that are at the same time latency-critical and computing-parsimonious get typically deployed on edge facilities. For these reasons
column43: selecting a Cloud server is wise whenever a user application is both computing-intensive and delay-insensitive. The availability of diverse and geographically distributed computing resources raises the question of which computing element is the most suitable to meet the specified application requirement. It becomes even more relevant for applications that do not fall into the two extreme categories above. Consider a scenario where end-users exploit a slice of a mobile network
column44: issuing service requests intermittently to the network computing facilities and needing an answer within a specified fixed deadline. column15: Le interazioni umane condotte tramite i servizi web e mobili o catturate con sensori intelligenti generano grandi flussi di dati dinamici complessi che possono essere integrati in applicazioni per fornire servizi centrati sull'uomo. Analizzare tali fonti di informazione eterogenee e integrare le loro dimensioni spaziali
column16: semantiche e temporali è una sfida
column17: perché tali interazioni sono spesso troppo complesse per essere catturate attraverso modelli analitici.L'obiettivo della ricerca è quello di sviluppare teorie e metodi basati su idee provenienti dal dominio dell'apprendimento della rappresentazione al fine di modellare queste osservazioni attraverso reti neurali profonde. Gli ultimi 10 anni hanno visto l'emergere dell'apprendimento della rappresentazione come un tema importante nel machine learning

column34: Human interactions conducted via both the web and mobile services or captured with intelligent sensors generate large flows of complex dynamic data that can be integrated into applications to provide human centered services. Analyzing such heterogeneous information sources and integrating their spatial
column35: semantic and temporal dimensions is challenging
column36: because such interactions are often too complex to be captured through analytical models.The research objective is to develop theory and methods based on ideas coming from the representation learning domain in order to model these observations through deep neural networks. The last 10 years have witnessed the emergence of representation learning as a major topic in machine learning
column37: as evidenced by the recent creation in 2013 of the International Conference on Learning Representations. column16: Dealing with complex systems in dynamic environments is not an easy task. Optimization approaches developed to deal with complex systems are often based on several assumptions. One of the most important assumptions is that the knowledge of data is either through full definition of deterministic parameters or via some description of the behavior of uncertain data. Nevertheless
column17: even finding a description of data behavior to embed within an optimization scheme is not an easy task. Further
column18: it is unlikely in reality that all the information needed to define a problem instance is available beforehand. Thus decisions have to be made based on incomplete information (e.g. when the operative scenario and problem data are not completely known).Stochastic optimization (SOp) and online optimization (OOp) provide two ways to deal with partial knowledge of data. SOp refers to methods for optimizing an objective function when randomness is present. If incomplete information is represented through uncertainty of parameters

column10: EUMaster4HPC - European Master For High-Performance Computing (H2020-JTI-EuroHPC-2020-03)
column16: Advancing education and training in High Performance Computing (HPC) and its applicability to HPDA andAI is essential for strengthening the world-class European HPC ecosystem. It is of primary importance to ensurethe digital transformation and the sustainability of high-priority economic sectors. Missing educated and skilled professionals in HPC/HPDA/AI could prevent Europe from creating socio-economic value with HPC. The Hpc EuRopean ConsortiUm Leading Education activities (HERCULES) aims to develop a new and innovative European Master programme focusing on high performance solutions to address these issues. The master programme aims at catalysing various aspects of the HPC ecosystem and its applications into different scientific and industrial domains. HERCULES brings together major players in HPC education in Europe and mobilises them to unify existing programs into a common European curriculum. It leverages experience from various European countries and HPC communities to generate European added value beyond the potential of any single university. HERCULES emphasizes on collaboration across Europe with innovative teaching paradigms including co-teaching and the cooperative development of new content relying on the best specialists in HPC education in Europe. Employers

column21: teachers and industrial experts. A particular focus on mobility of students and teachers will enable students to rapidly gain experience through internships and exposure to European supercomputing centres

column31: Procedural knowledge spans the most disparate sectors from engineering to economy

column18: Il concetto di dieta sana non è nuovo
column19: poiché è riconosciuto che una corretta alimentazione è essenziale per la buona salute
column20: il benessere e la prevenzione delle malattie. Tuttavia
column21: come dimostrato da recenti evidenze
column22: le linee guida alimentari che premiano e promuovono scelte alimentari sane non sono più sufficienti. Infatti
column23: gli attuali sistemi di produzione alimentare utilizzano il 48% della terra e il 70% delle risorse di acqua dolce
column24: per cui è necessario fare un passo avanti e definire una nuova visione dell'alimentazione che coniughi allo stesso tempo salubrità e sostenibilità. Questa necessità è sottolineata anche dagli obiettivi del UN Decade of Action on Nutrition 2016-25
column25: nonché da alcuni dei target inclusi negli Obiettivi di sviluppo sostenibile (SDG) 3 e SDG12. In poche parole
column26: è urgente sviluppare metodi per indirizzare le persone a consumare alimenti sani e a basso impatto ambientale. In questo contesto
column27: la combinazione di sistemi di raccomandazione (RS) e agenti conversazionali (CA) rappresenta una direzione promettente per raggiungere questo obiettivo. Infatti
column28: i primi hanno già dimostrato di poter influenzare le scelte degli utenti e condurli a decisioni migliori
column29: mentre i secondi possono migliorare ulteriormente l'efficacia delle raccomandazioni sfruttando l'interazione in linguaggio naturale. Tuttavia
column30: il potenziale che deriva dall'integrazione di CA e RS è quasi ancora inesplorato.Infatti
column31: i RS non presentano i loro suggerimenti con sufficiente trasparenza e i CA non dedicano sufficiente attenzione alla progettazione di strategie di interazione persuasiva in grado di cambiare la percezione delle persone e di influenzare concretamente le loro scelte (alimentari). Inoltre
column32: mentre la salubrità delle ricette è già stata presa in considerazione per fornire raccomandazioni alimentari consapevoli della salute
column33: il concetto di sostenibilità è completamente trascurato nella ricerca sui RS alimentari. Di conseguenza
column34: il progetto mira a colmare queste lacune progettando e sviluppando metodologie innovative per facilitare la transizione verso abitudini alimentari più sane e sostenibili. Questo obiettivo sarà raggiunto attraverso la combinazione di algoritmi di generazione di linguaggio naturale
column35: di risposta alle domande e di raccomandazione
column36: che saranno integrati in un CA con interazione in linguaggio naturale. In breve
column37: il nostro CA consentirà agli utenti di: (i) formulare domande sulla salubrità e la sostenibilità delle ricette; (ii) identificare ingredienti e pasti sostitutivi (cioè più sostenibili); (iii) ottenere raccomandazioni personalizzate su ricette sane e sostenibili in base alle esigenze personali. Tutte le interazioni si baseranno su strategie di dialogo persuasive che spiegheranno il comportamento dell'algoritmo e renderanno i suggerimenti più convincenti. La validità del nostro framework sarà garantita da un approccio di progettazione partecipativa. Coinvolgeremo i nostri utenti target nella progettazione e nella valutazione della soluzione
column38: oltre che in uno studio finale. Attraverso lo studio
column39: ci proponiamo di valutare che il nostro CA possa aumentare la consapevolezza e la percezione degli utenti sulla salubrità e la sostenibilità degli alimenti
column40: aprendo così la strada a un consumo alimentare responsabile.
column41: The concept of healthy diet is not new
column42: since it is acknowledged that proper nutrition is essential for good health
column43: well-being and prevention of diseases. However
column45: eating guidelines that reward and promote healthy food choices are not sufficient anymore. Indeed
column46: current food production systems use 48% of land and 70% of fresh water resources
column47: so it is necessary to step up and to define a new vision of eating that combines at the same time healthiness and sustainability. This need is also emphasized by the goals of UN Decade of Action on Nutrition 2016–25
column48: as well as by some of the targets included in Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) 3 and SDG12. In a nutshell
column49: it is urgent to develop methods to direct people to consume food that is healthy and with a low environmental impact. In this context
column50: the combination of recommender systems (RS) and conversational agents (CA) represents a promising direction to achieve this goal. Indeed
column51: the former already showed that they can influence users’ choices and lead them to better decisions
column52: and the latter can further improve the effectiveness of the recommendations by exploiting natural language interaction. However
column53: the potential that comes from the integration of CA and RS is almost still unexplored. Indeed
column54: RS do not present their suggestions with sufficient transparency
column55: and CA do not devote enough attention to the design of persuasive interaction strategies able to change people's perceptions and concretely influence their (food) choices. Moreover
column56: while the healthiness of recipes has been already considered to provide health-aware food recommendations
column57: the concept of sustainability is completely overlooked in food RS research. Accordingly
column58: the project aims to fill these gaps by designing and developing innovative methodologies to facilitate the transition towards healthier and sustainable eating habits. This will be achieved through the combination of natural language generation
column59: question answering and recommendation algorithms that will be integrated into a CA featuring natural language interaction. In a nutshell
column60: our CA will allow users to: (i) formulate questions about healthiness and sustainability of recipes; (ii) identify substitute (i.e.
column61: more sustainable) ingredients and meals; (iii) get personalized recommendations about healthy and sustainable recipes tailored to personal needs. All the interaction will rely on persuasive dialogue strategies that will explain the behavior of the algorithm and will make suggestions more convincing. The validity of our framework will be ensured through a participatory design approach. We will involve our target users in the design and assessment of the solution
column62: as well as in a final study. Through the study
column63: we aim to assess that our CA can increase users’ awareness and perception about healthiness and sustainability of food
column64: thus paving the way for responsible food consumption.

column24: POLINE aims at developing an AI-powered pilot tool for the retrieval and analysis of judicial principles of law in the CJEU and nationalcase-law in Value Added Tax (VAT). The tool relies on AI techniques for extracting

column32: and NLP techniques for the automatic extraction of principles
